info.title: Safe Internet Practices
info.description: This quiz tests your knowledge on recognizing safe vs. unsafe websites, encryption, VPNs, and securely using public Wi-Fi.

questions.question: Which of the following is a sign that a website is secure?
options: It has a padlock icon and 'https://' in the address bar
It loads quickly with no advertisements
It asks for your credit card details on the homepage
It has a professional design and layout
questions.answer: It has a padlock icon and 'https://' in the address bar

questions.question: What does encryption do in online communication?
options: Scrambles data so that only authorized users can read it
Hides your internet activity from your employer
Speeds up your internet connection
Prevents pop-up ads from appearing on websites
questions.answer: Scrambles data so that only authorized users can read it

questions.question: Why is it important to use a Virtual Private Network (VPN) when browsing on public Wi-Fi?
options: It encrypts your internet connection to protect your data
It makes your internet speed faster
It allows you to bypass work-related website restrictions
It automatically removes malware from websites
questions.answer: It encrypts your internet connection to protect your data

questions.question: Which of the following is the safest way to log in to an online account?
options: Using a unique, strong password and enabling Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
Using the same password for all accounts to make it easier to remember
Saving your password in an unencrypted text file on your desktop
Using a short password that is easy to type quickly
questions.answer: Using a unique, strong password and enabling Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)

questions.question: What should you avoid doing when using public Wi-Fi?
options: Accessing sensitive accounts like online banking or work emails
Streaming videos or listening to music
Checking the weather or reading news articles
Visiting public websites without logging in
questions.answer: Accessing sensitive accounts like online banking or work emails

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a recommended practice for online security?
options: Clicking on links from unknown senders to check their authenticity
Keeping your software and browser up to date
Using strong and unique passwords for different accounts
Enabling Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) whenever possible
questions.answer: Clicking on links from unknown senders to check their authenticity

questions.question: What does 'phishing' typically involve?
options: Tricking users into providing personal information through fake emails or websites
A new type of malware that spreads through social media
An encryption method used to secure Wi-Fi networks
A secure way to send login credentials online
questions.answer: Tricking users into providing personal information through fake emails or websites

questions.question: Which of the following passwords is the most secure?
options: P@ssw0rd123!
CorrectHorseBatteryStaple123!
Password2023

questions.question: If a website asks for sensitive information but lacks 'https://' in the URL, what should you do?
options: Avoid entering any personal or financial information
Enter your information quickly to minimize exposure
Only proceed if the website looks professional
Use a different browser to see if 'https://' appears
questions.answer: Avoid entering any personal or financial information

questions.question: What is the safest way to browse the internet?
options: Using a VPN, keeping software updated, and avoiding suspicious links
Opening multiple browser tabs to prevent tracking
Using public Wi-Fi without any encryption
Clicking on pop-ups that offer free security tools
questions.answer: Using a VPN, keeping software updated, and avoiding suspicious links
